On #WorldHealthDay and #NationalPublicHealthWeek  2021, I want to highlight a public health issue that is dispositionally plaguing Black Women and girls #UterineFibroids. ⤵️ [A thread]

An estimated 26 million individuals in the U.S., and approximately 25 % of Black women will suffer from Uterine Fibroids by the age of 25, and 80 % will have them by age 50. Additionally, Black women suffer from this pervasive ailment at a disproportionately earlier age! ⤵️

#Uterinefibroids are noncancerous growths of the uterus. symptoms include severe menstrual bleeding, anemia, fatigue, pain, bladder or bowel dysfunction, impaired fertility, and pregnancy complications and loss. Black women tend to get fibroids at a younger age and suffer more ⤵️

... We are 2.4 times more likely to undergo hysterectomy and have a 6.8-fold increase of undergoing uterine-sparing myomectomy. This disease has ravaged the lives of women — particularly in the Black community — across the country ⤵️

..Symptoms are debilitating, and existing treatment options can impact fertility. We need to do more research and expand what we know about uterine fibroids to better treat people for this condition. This research is critical for Black Women ⤵️
